questions.question: The traveler asked the stranger if he ...................................... the way to the nearest inn.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, we will most probably need a past tense in the subordinate clause. The past perfect is not possible here because we are not talking about the 'earlier past'.

questions.question: The dentist suggested ....................................... my toothpaste.
questions.description: Suggest is one of those verbs that cannot be followed by a to-infinitive. It can be followed by an -ing form or a that-clause.

questions.question: The terrorist's attempt to ............................................. the bridge was foiled by the police.
questions.description: Blow up' means 'to destroy someone or something by explosion'.

questions.question: In his budget speech, the Finance Minister ................................. many bold reforms.
questions.description: 'Bring forward' means 'to introduce someone or something'.

questions.question: The suspects are still ....................................
questions.description: 'At large' means 'free uncaptured (usually said of criminals not in custody)'.

questions.question: The dilapidated building was not .....................................
questions.description: We need an adjective (habitable) here the other two options are nouns.

questions.question: ....................................... of the three boys attended the class.
questions.description: Either and neither are used to speak of two people or things.

questions.question: There were .................................. than twenty people present.
questions.description: Less is used with uncountable nouns and fewer is used with countable nouns.

questions.question: Mumbai is ................................... of India.
questions.description: Articles are used with proper nouns used as epithets.

questions.question: There are no secrets between you and .................................
questions.description: Between is a preposition. A pronoun following a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: .................................. buses are supposed to depart at a certain hour, they are often late.
questions.description: Although is a conjunction we need a conjunction to connect two clauses.

questions.question: Have you received any .................................. so far?
questions.description: Information is uncountable and as such it does not have a plural form.
